text.text_translated: The first signs of human civilisation, like cave paintings, appeared between 100,000 and 50,000 years ago, but no one knows how this is connected to language. Although brains did not suddenly get bigger, humans became more complex and intelligent. This raises the question of whether using language caused their brains to develop, or if their more complex brains started to produce language.
